ADMISSION DATE :
**DATE[May 22 2007]
DISCHARGE DATE :
**DATE[May 25 2007]
PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS ( ES ) :
LUMBAR INSTABILITY .
PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE :
REDO L4-5 DECOMPRESSION , RIGHT L4-5 MICRODISKECTOMY WITH INSTRUMENTED FUSION , AND BONE MORPHOGENIC PROTEIN .
REASON FOR ADMISSION :
Miss **NAME[AAA] is an unfortunately **AGE[in 30s]- year - old female who underwent two prior L4-5 microdiskectomies .
One for left - sided symptoms in **DATE[Jun] of 2005 and another for right - sided symptoms in **DATE[Mar] of 2006 .
She had redeveloped right leg pain and significant low back pain .
Imaging studies demonstrated a recurrent right L4-5 disk herniation .
After failing conservative treatment to elected to undergo the aforementioned surgery on **DATE[May 22]nd and was admitted postoperatively for management .
HOSPITAL COURSE :
Postoperatively Miss **NAME[AAA] noticed improvement in her right leg pain .
Her biggest complaint was that of postoperative incisional pain which was adequately managed with patient controlled anesthesia and eventually oral narcotics .
Her OxyContin dosage was increased to 20 milligrams twice daily .
On postoperative day number three she remains afebrile .
Stable vital signs were noted with an intact lower extremity motor exam .
Her incision is clean , dry and intact with staples in place .
She is tolerating oral intake , voiding independently and ambulating well without difficulty .
She has been seen by Physical Therapy and Occupational Therapy and felt to be stable for discharge to home with no needs .
DISCHARGE INSTRUCTIONS :
1. Activity :
No heavy lifting or strenuous activity .
2. No bending at the waist or standing for long periods of time .
3. She may shower however she avoid scrubbing or soaking the incision for a total of two weeks after surgery .
4. She should avoid driving while on narcotics .
5. She is to avoid all tobacco products and anti - inflammatory medications as it has the potential of weakening the fusion .
6. She is to wear a Cybertec brace when out - of - bed .
FOLLOW - UP :
She has an appointment on Tuesday , **DATE[Jun 6]th , at 9 a.m. with Dr. **NAME[ZZZ] .
She should continue **PHONE if she needs to change this appointment or if she develops any fevers , chills , sweats , increased wound erythema or drainage , increased pain , weakness , numbness , bowel or bladder dysfunction .
Her staples will be removed at that appointment .
DISCHARGE MEDICATIONS :
1. OxyContin 20 milligrams q. 12 hours ( dispense #26 with no refills ) .
2. Roxicodone 15 milligrams one tablet q. 4 hours as required ( dispense #80 tablets with no refills ) .
3. Over - the - counter Senokot two tablets daily for constipation .
___________________________________
